original: Almbladh, Oscar, e. provinsiaiMäkare, Eksjö, f. 20/5/01 i Mönsterås, Kalmar 1., av med. lic. Emil A. o. Matilda Hullgren. — Stud:ex. i Lund 21, med. kand. i Upps. 27, med. lic. i Sthlm 34. E. assist, v. Målilla -sanat. samt v. Norrköp. las. kir. avd. 34-35, tf. e. prov :läk. i Stranda o. Stegeborgs distr. kortare tider 35, tf. undrläk. o. assist :iäk. v. Karlstads las. kir. avd. 36-36, e. läk. v. Mora las. 36, auskul-tant v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. oto-laryngo-log. klin. o. poliklin. 36-37, e. läk. v. Sthlms epid isjukh. 37, und :läk. v. Mora las. 37-41, tf. läk. v. Dalslands sjukh. i Bäckefors samt tf. prov :läk. i Ekshärad kort. tid. 41, und :läk. v. Eksjö sanat. 41-43, tf. andre läk. v. Ryhovs sjukh. i Jönköp. 43, tf. stads-läk. i Vimmerby, Djursholm o. Tors-hälla samt tf. prov:läk. i Tingsryd, Mariefred, Grums, Bollnäs, Nås, Leksand o. Gnesta kort. tid. 43-46, läk. v. SvRK ambulanssjukh. i Nordnorge 45, e. proviläk. i Aneby distr. 46, i Eksjö di:slr. ’sed. 47.
translated: Almbladh, Oscar, former provincial physician, born May 20, 1901 in Mönsterås, Kalmar County, to medical licentiate Emil A. and Matilda Hullgren. He graduated from Lund University in 1921, received his medical degree from Uppsala University in 1927 and his medical license in Stockholm in 1934. He was the assistant physician at Målilla Sanatorium and Norrköping University Hospital's surgical ward from 1934-1935, acting provincial physician in Stranda and Stegeborg's district for a short time in 1935, temporary physician and assistant physician at Karolinska University Hospital in 1936, physician at Mora County Hospital in 1936, intern at Sabbatsberg Hospital's oto-laryngology department and polyclinic from 1936-1937, physician at Stockholm's epidemic hospital in 1937, assistant physician at Mora County Hospital from 1937-1941, temporary physician at Dalsland Hospital in Bäckefors and acting provincial physician in Ekshärad briefly in 1941, acting provincial physician at Eksjö Sanatorium from 1941-1943, temporary second physician at Ryhov Hospital in Jönköping in 1943, temporary city physician in Vimmerby, Djursholm, Tors-hälla and acting provincial physician in Tingsryd, Mariefred, Grums, Bollnäs, Nås, Leksand and Gnesta for a brief time from 1943-1946. He was a physician at the Swedish Red Cross ambulance hospital in northern Norway in 1945, provincial physician in Aneby district in 1946 and in Eksjö district from 1947 onwards.

education.description: Received medical degree from Uppsala University
